subject: Re: Urgent sampling project
preview: Woohoo! Victory 😊  Warm regards,  Lucy Pittman Marketing Manager  t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

full_threads.body:
Woohoo! Victory 😊

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hey Lucy, 

Just closing the loop on this chain. Looks like the IT company has lifted a block of some sort. Woohoo!

Hi Heath,

What do you mean by email account? Like an email account outside of Acoufelt?

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Ok that's good news! 

Can you please try to do one using your email account and see if that comes through?

Heath,

FYI the test sample order you just placed has come through to hello@acoufelt.

Not sure where mine and the other team's orders are coming through to or if this helps with working out the problem?

Thanks

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Noted Lucy, I have double checked all of the sending setup and it's all correct at our end. I suspect it may be getting stuck by the Acoufelt email server. Here is a video run through to show the orders are definitely coming through and I'm receiving the customer emails: https://www.loom.com/share/4fa17b99000c4fe0b91a9f3aa0d6c316

Let me know if this order I just did came through to hello@

Can you see them on the backend as entries?

Warm regards,

Ben Grace
Managing Director - Global
t +61 1800.62.64.62 m +61 407.075.840Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hi Heath,

Think this will work well - however am still concerned that the team receiving hello@acoufelt emails aren't receiving any sample requests.. I have placed 3 or 4 since end of last week and none have come through.

We are sending out an EDM to our database today on our range of means for staying in touch, which includes ordering samples online, so am looking to have this fixed up ASAP.

Please let me know what I can do to help here.

Thanks Heath!

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hi Lucy, 

Regarding the sampling being specific to the product. I have made it more generic as discussed so that we can learn more info as to what the market is keen on. Here is an example: https://acoufelt.com/au/product/fracture-chevron-acoustic-panel/ You can select either the collection or individual option. You will then see the 'disclaimer' style copy as mentioned. 

Let me know what you think?

Hi Lucy, 

Thanks for the extra info the cart is now fixed on the /au/ site. It was a quick one. 

We will work on the sampling updates for you and get you an update. 

Can you please check the spam/junk folder of the hello@ inbox as they emails are definitely sending.

Hey Heath,

If this can work then yes I like the idea of capturing this information. Could you perhaps show me what this would look like on an example product page?

RE the cart error message:

I have selected 3 x samples but it says 'your cart is currently empty' etc.



If I click 'proceed to checkout' at this stage, it will take me to a form to fill in my details



Once I have submitted by details I land on this page, confirming my order has been received ^. The team has told me that these would normally go to hello@acoufelt.com - however this information is not coming through to the team.

Hope this helps Heath!

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hi Lucy, 

Thanks for this. 

Regarding the cart error message:

Which sub site were you on specifically? We tested all three this morning. This will help us to delve into your specific scenario. When taking a screen shot it's always super helpful for us to include the URL/address bar.  

Regarding the sampling changes:

We will look into the best way to achieve this. Currently we are working on the basis that everything is available to sample.

Question about this, would it be beneficial for the customer care or sales team members to know which colourways/designs the prospect is interested in? If so, we could leave as is and add a statement along the lines of, "Please select your preferred colourways/designs. We will endeavour to send you the samples you have selected or relevant samples from this range." 

I see the benefit of this being three fold: 

  1. We are collecting more relevant data on what colourways are in demand (pre-purchase data, currently we will only be receiving post-purchase data).
  2. If we end up having some of these samples on hand, we can then dispatch those, creating a better customer experience.
  3. We may see patterns of colourways/designs that are in high-demand, at which point it may make sense to stock these samples.
Let me know how you would like to proceed?

Thanks for this - however we are still running into problems at checkout after samples are selected - it says cart is empty… also when requests are submitted, this info is still not feeding across to customer care.



We will also need to break all of our products up into sampling available in 'Complete range' vs 'Individual samples' as well as N/A.

I will send through a table to explain - attached.

On the acoustic art page could we also please change the tab from 'order free sample' to 'Request a quote'.

Thanks!

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hi Lucy, 

Confirming this is now fixed, here is a dummy/test one we just put through. We are rolling this out to the other two sites as well: 
https://acoufelt.com/checkout/order-received/18752/?key=wc_order_4KXgGbQDQUj1C

It will be completed in 15min.
Think the my account page is missing

Hey Heath,

Really important that we nail sampling on the website given current state of things – have noticed a few pages aren’t working (see below), and also a few of the options for sampling are incorrect/unavailable…



What do you need from us in order to get this up and running Heath? Happy to jump on a call as would like this nailed today.

Thanks!


Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager
